ResourceHeader.Description: Hobart station is located on Hobart, Tasmania Island. It has been in operation since December 1945.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: Please acknowledge: Space Weather Network, Bureau of Meteorology, Australia

InformationURL.Name: ASWS Observatory Information: Hobart
InformationURL.Description: includes observatory/station name, location, lifetime, identity and datasets informtion.

ResourceHeader.Description:
The Hobart Magnetometer station in Hobart, Tasmania, Australia, has a Magnetometer since October 1998.
28 October, 1998 --------------- Data type: "b" Magnetometer VM2 and 16-bit A/D acquisition system installed at station.
For more information, please read its log file.

InformationURL.Name: ASWS Hobart Instrument Fluxgate Magenetometer Log File

ResourceHeader.Description: The Hobart Ionosonde station near Hobart, Tasmania, Australia, has ionosondes since December 1945. The first is an analog ionosonde with nitrate film from 12/1945 to 11/1951. Between 09/11/1951 and 01/06/1977, there was an ionosonde with 35 mm film. According to SWS archived Hobart scaled ionospheric data book, At least between 90/1970 and 12/1970 the ionosonde was IPS 3D. Between 02/06/1977 and 20/12/1996, there was an ionosonde with 16 mm film in operation. According to SWS archived Weekly Station Summary, there was an IPS 4B at least from 17/03/1982 and an IPS 3E in the year of 1982 too. There was an IPS 4D between 28/02/1994 and 15/09/2001, an IPS 5A between 09/01/1991 and 17/04/1997, and a CADI between 14/10/1998 and 16/02/2009. There is an IPS 5D since 24/09/1998 to now. The IPS 5D vertical sounding ionosonde normally sweeps in frequency from about 1.0 to 21.5 MHz. Frequency step resolution for the 5D is 5 kHz, with up to 4095 steps available. The step interval is variable, becoming more coarse at higher frequencies as ionograms are generally displayed on a logarithmic scale.
